verses.roman:
'māyā-sītā' rāvaṇa nila, śunilā ākhyāne
śuni' mahāprabhu haila ānandita mane

synonyms: māyā-sītā—false, illusory Sītā; rāvaṇa—the demon Rāvaṇa; nila—took; śunilā—heard; ākhyāne—in the narration of the Kūrma Purāṇa; śuni'-hearing this; mahāprabhu—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; haila—became; ānandita—very happy; mane—within the mind.
translation: Upon hearing from the Kūrma Purāṇa how Rāvaṇa had kidnapped a false form of mother Sītā, Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu became very much satisfied.
